instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No power, MagSafe light turns green and off, then repeats
threads.message:
Anyone experience this fail before, when the MagSafe is connected, it keeps flashing green and then goes off, then repeats. Does this over and over. 
Once i go to test <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> the voltage starts to drop from about 11v and the MagSafe stops flashing, stays off. Same on <SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN_ISOL</SIGNAL>. When measured at F6905, i get about 15v just before it starts to drop, but it keeps repeating. I pulled <TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR> and confirmed <SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN_CONN</SIGNAL> had 16V on it. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No power, MagSafe light turns green and off, then repeats
threads.message:
Does it work with pre-charged battery?
Possibly leakage on the input MOSFET.
Post <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>/86 values, measured on the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No power, MagSafe light turns green and off, then repeats
threads.message:
Looks like <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> may be the issue. 
<RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> measures to 0.407K when it should be 100K
<RESISTOR>R7081</RESISTOR> - 62K approx
<RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> - 472K approx
<RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> - 333K

And with battery connected, the spans spins for about a second and shutoff. 
Going to pull <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No power, MagSafe light turns green and off, then repeats
threads.message:
So magsafe has stopped blinking and acting like it should. New issue, the fan spins for about a second the shuts off, then repeats and keeps doing this. 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.58v
<SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN_ISOL</SIGNAL> - 16.5v when the fan is off, and 20.5 once the fan kicks on before it shuts off again and goes back to 16.5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No power, MagSafe light turns green and off, then repeats
threads.message: Was this board messed with? Fans that do on/off is not a good sign :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No power, MagSafe light turns green and off, then repeats
threads.message: The guy said it was a faulty power supply, having the polarities reverse. Not sure how he would have done that unless if he was attempting to repair the MagSafe.
